page.title: 18Religious Controversies
page.content: Currently controversial issues include the legalising of Sunday trading, without the restrictions which apply at present. Methodists are amongst those who resist this. The ordination of women is an emotive issue, it has been accepted in principle by the Church of England, but has not yet been put into practice. Non-conformist Churches have already experienced this transformation. The role of the Church in the community has been under recent scrutiny, priests are involved in Age Concern, Youth Clubs, Sport and the County Council; the theology of the priest appears secondary to their activity in the community;but they are also prepared to speak out on matters from Apartheid to Government Social Policy. The future of the Church is in the ecumenical movement, but progress is slow.
